intro: Premna grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaf curlweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often pubescent. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, globose fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ability to tolerate various soil types make it a common garden plant in some regions.
